channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Changing China: Why Xi Jinping is leading a way back to socialism
item.description: China has not been very socialist for years, but the Communist Party looks set to change that.

item.title: Taiwan seeks entry into key trade pact before China
item.description: Taiwan has warned that its application into the CPTPP could be affected should China join first.

item.title: Covishield: UK recognises Covid jab after India outcry
item.description: With more than 721 million doses administered so far, Covishield is India's most widely used vaccine.

item.title: Lithuania urges people to throw away Chinese phones
item.description: The country's National Cyber Security Centre found security risks in both Xiaomi and Huawei models.

item.title: Myanmar: Whole town flees amid fierce fighting
item.description: Fighting between the army and militia forces in Thantlang, Chin state, has worsened in recent days.

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: Crew member's Covid case triggers lockdown
item.description: A crew member on I'm a Celebrity tests positive, sending thousands into lockdown and sparking a backlash.

item.title: Second Afghan data breach by UK defence ministry
item.description: The MoD apologises again as it emerges dozens of people were mistakenly copied in to another email.

item.title: 'Side-eying Chloe' Clem to sell iconic meme as NFT
item.description: The image of Chloe Clem could fetch her tens of thousands of dollars at auction.

item.title: Melbourne protests: Third day of violent anti-vaccine demonstrations
item.description: Demonstrators have been marching against lockdowns and mandatory vaccines in Australia's second largest city.

item.title: China pledges to stop building new coal energy plants abroad
item.description: The announcement is the country's latest climate pledge and a major step forward to address emissions.

item.title: Evergrande: Crisis-hit firm strikes China debt deal
item.description: The company is also due to make a $83.5m interest payment on an offshore bond on Thursday.

item.title: Taliban ask to speak at UN General Assembly in New York
item.description: The group wants to address world leaders, weeks after ousting Afghanistan's former government.

item.title: Pew study: Little change in India's religious make-up in 70 years
item.description: The population trebled in 70 years but saw few changes to its religious composition, a study shows.

item.title: Aukus: Australia's big gamble on the US over China
item.description: Australia has taken a central role in the Aukus defence pact - there are major benefits and risks too.

item.title: Melbourne earthquake: Australians react to rare quake that rattled country
item.description: One resident thought the 5.9 magnitude quake was just his neighbours doing an intense workout.

item.title: Cambodia: The autistic teenager jailed over a Telegram post
item.description: He allegedly insulted Cambodia's government, prompting heavily-armed policemen to arrest him.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fighting off hunger under the Taliban
item.description: For most Afghans staving off starvation is the biggest challenge since the Taliban returned to power.

item.title: Giving birth under the Taliban
item.description: Pregnant women, new mothers and infants are bearing the brunt of a worsening healthcare crisis.

item.title: India Covid-19: Meet the teacher who turned a street into a classroom
item.description: A primary school teacher has found an innovative way to resume classes in India's rural West Bengal state.
